titlestmt.titleproper: Reminiscences of Joseph Kirby Corson, circa 1880-1910

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Reminiscences of Joseph Kirby Corson, circa 1880-1910
did.abstract: Typescript portion of reminiscent diary written about 1910, concerning his U.S. Army service in Prescott and Yuma, Arizona; accompanied by letters from Lt. John McEwen Hyde, concerning the Chemehuevi Indians on the Colorado River Indian Reservation in 1880.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Reminiscences of Joseph Kirby Corson (AZ 257). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Surgeon, U.S. Army; stationed at Prescott, Ariz. and Yuma, Ariz., between 1878 and 1882.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Typescript portion of reminiscent diary written about 1910, concerning his U.S. Army service in Prescott and Yuma, Arizona; accompanied by letters from Lt. John McEwen Hyde, concerning the Chemehuevi Indians on the Colorado River Indian Reservation in 1880.

item.geogname: Colorado River Indian Reservation (Ariz. and Calif.) -- History.
